flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
stripped_text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

flavor: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"
stripped_text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
title: Quetzal: Free Spirit

stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2 credits for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
title: Queen's Gambit

flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn. Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
title: Quest Completed

stripped_text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
title: Retrieval Run

flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy
stripped_text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.
text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.
title: Run Amok

stripped_text: Place 9 credits on this event, then run any server. During that run, hosted credits are considered to be in your credit pool. When the run ends, suffer 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented. Errata from CR 1.4
text:
Place 9[credit] on this event, then run any server. During that run, hosted credits are considered to be in your credit pool. When the run ends, suffer 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
title: Stimhack

flavor: I feel almost naked without it.
stripped_text: 1 recurring credit Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
title: Cyberfeeder

stripped_text: +1 mu Interrupt  Once per turn, when you would play or install a card, you may trash 1 card from your grip to lower the play or install cost by 2. Limit 1 console per player. Errata from CR 1.4
text: +1[mu] [interrupt] – Once per turn, when you would play or install a card, you may trash 1 card from your grip to lower the play or install cost by 2. Limit 1 console per player. Errata from CR 1.4
title: Patchwork

flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." -g00ru
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break barrier subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength.
text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
title: Corroder

stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
title: Datasucker

flavor: It always strikes twice.
stripped_text: 2 credits: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1 credit: +1 strength.
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
title: Force of Nature

flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
stripped_text: Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed. Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost). Errata from CR 1.2
text: Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed. Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost). Errata from CR 1.2
title: Imp

stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1 credit. Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[credit].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
title: Lamprey

flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break sentry subroutine.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
title: Mimic

flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corps need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
stripped_text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
title: Ice Carver

flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
stripped_text: Place 16 credits from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it. click: Take 4 credits from Liberated Account.
text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.
title: Liberated Account

flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits Use these credits to trash cards.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
title: Scrubber

flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
stripped_text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
title: Xanadu

flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
stripped_text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2 credits.
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."
stripped_text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
title: Leela Patel: Trained Pragmatist

flavor: "You can help Jinteki shape the future. Your future."
stripped_text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.
text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.
title: Career Fair

flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
stripped_text: Gain 3 credits.
text: Gain 3[credit].
title: Easy Mark

flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Derez a piece of ice.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
title: Emergency Shutdown

stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
title: Hostage

flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
stripped_text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
title: Inside Job

flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
stripped_text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
title: Legwork

flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgment of the corporate simpletons she met there.
stripped_text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1 credit to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1[credit] to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
title: Networking

flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.
stripped_text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
title: Spear Phishing

flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
stripped_text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
title: Special Order

flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
stripped_text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
title: HQ Interface

stripped_text: +1 mu The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may gain 1 credit and look at the top card of your stack. If you do, you may add that card to the bottom of your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +1[mu] The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may gain 1[credit] and look at the top card of your stack. If you do, you may add that card to the bottom of your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Paragon

flavor: "Technology breeds crime."
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break code gate subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength. trash: Bypass a piece of code gate ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Abagnale.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of code gate ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Abagnale.
title: Abagnale

flavor: "It's a matter of 'acquiring' the right credentials."
stripped_text: 2 credits: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2 credits: +3 strength. trash: Bypass a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Demara.
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Demara.
title: Demara

flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
stripped_text: 0 credits: Break sentry subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
text: 0[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
title: Faerie

stripped_text: 1 credit: Break sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1 credit per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
title: Femme Fatale

flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru
stripped_text: click: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, instead change the attacked server to HQ. Then, the run is declared successful. Errata from CR 1.4
text:
[click]: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, instead change the attacked server to HQ. Then, the run is declared successful.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
title: Sneakdoor Beta

stripped_text: Place 8 credits from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it. Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
title: Bank Job

flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.
stripped_text: Forfeit an agenda, click: Gain 9 credits.
text: Forfeit an agenda, [click]: Gain 9[credit].
title: Data Dealer

flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
stripped_text: +1 mu
title: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."
stripped_text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of the run. Errata from CR 1.4
text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of the run. Errata from CR 1.4
title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
stripped_text: Draw 3 cards.
text: Draw 3 cards.
title: Diesel

flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars, and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
stripped_text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
title: Modded

flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn. Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
title: Notoriety

stripped_text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
title: Test Run

flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
stripped_text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
title: The Maker's Eye

flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
stripped_text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
title: Tinkering

flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.
stripped_text: +1 mu
title: Akamatsu Mem Chip

stripped_text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Dinosaurus

flavor: Works best at your own desk.
stripped_text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card from R&D.
text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card from R&D.
title: R&D Interface

flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
stripped_text: When you install Atman, you may pay X credits to place X power counters on Atman. Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1 credit: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
title: Atman

flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
stripped_text: 2 credits: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Battering Ram

flavor: Didn't see that coming.
stripped_text: trash: Break any number of AP subroutines. trash: Prevent any amount of net damage.
text: [trash]: Break any number of AP subroutines. [trash]: Prevent any amount of net damage.
title: Deus X

flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break code gate subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Gordian Blade

stripped_text: 1 credit: Break sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Pipeline

flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
stripped_text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3 credits.
text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].
title: Aesop's Pawnshop

flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile
stripped_text: Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1 credit on Ice Analyzer. You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[credit] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
title: Ice Analyzer

flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
stripped_text: click: Gain 1 credit and draw 1 card.
text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
title: Professional Contacts

flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
stripped_text: Gain 9 credits.
text: Gain 9[credit].
title: Sure Gamble

flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
stripped_text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5 credits if it was successful.
text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[credit] if it was successful.
title: Dirty Laundry

stripped_text: 1 credit: Break ice subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength. click: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
title: Crypsis

flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.
title: Armitage Codebusting

text:
Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it.

flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."
stripped_text: The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card. The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
title: John Masanori

flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."
stripped_text: You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn. click: Place 3 credits from the bank on Kati Jones. click: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
title: Kati Jones

flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
stripped_text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
title: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

flavor: Interweaving the Past and the Future.

text: The first time each turn the Runner loses or spends [click] during a run, you may add 1 card from Archives to the top of R&D.

text:
Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.

Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.

text: Place 8[credit] on Marilyn Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Marilyn Campaign, trash it. Take 2[credit] from Marilyn Campaign when your turn begins. title: Marilyn Campaign

flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."

text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Eli 1.0

flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
stripped_text: The Runner can spend click to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0. Subroutine Do 1 brain damage. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run.
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Heimdall 1.0

flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.

The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.

title: Ichi 1.0

flavor: Whrrrrr!
stripped_text: Subroutine Trash 1 program. Subroutine End the run.
text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Rototurret

flavor: Alan Turing laid the foundation for artificial intelligence by suggesting that you could teach a computer to be human.
stripped_text: Turing has +3 strength while protecting a remote server. The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Turing. Subroutine End the run unless the Runner spends click click click.
text: Turing has +3 strength while protecting a remote server. The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Turing. [subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [click][click][click].
title: Turing

flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
stripped_text: The Runner can spend click to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0. Subroutine Do 1 brain damage. Subroutine End the run.
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Viktor 1.0

flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
stripped_text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
title: Archived Memories

flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
stripped_text: Gain click click.
text: Gain [click][click].
title: Biotic Labor

flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Gain 5 credits and draw 2 cards.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Gain 5[credit] and draw 2 cards.
title: Blue Level Clearance

flavor: "Eyes forward, please."
stripped_text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace 4 if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
title: Ash 2X3ZB9CY

flavor: "They say he is an ex-runner. I don't know if it is true, but he is chromed to the gills and seems to know all the runners' tricks."
stripped_text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses click, if able.
text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses [click], if able.
title: Mason Bellamy

flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.
stripped_text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

stripped_text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.
text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.
title: Jinteki: Replicating Perfection

stripped_text: If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives. As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2 credits.
text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives.
As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2[credit].
title: Fetal AI

stripped_text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
title: Nisei MK II

stripped_text: When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area. Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.
text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.
title: Philotic Entanglement

stripped_text: Project Junebug can be advanced. If you pay 1 credit when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
title: Project Junebug

flavor: "I will serve you…for a time."
stripped_text: Ronin can be advanced. If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "click, trash: Do 3 net damage."
text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."
title: Ronin

stripped_text: If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. If you pay 4 credits when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
title: Snare!

flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
stripped_text: The first time the Runner spends 1 or more click during their turn, gain 2 credits. If those click were spent to take an action, the first time during that action a run on this server begins, pay 2 credits. Errata from CR 1.2
text:
The first time the Runner spends 1 or more [click] during their turn, gain 2[credit]. If those [click] were spent to take an action, the first time during that action a run on this server begins, pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
title: Sundew

flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
stripped_text: 1 credit: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ. Subroutine End the run.
text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Himitsu-Bako

flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
stripped_text: The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered. Subroutine End the run.
text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Lotus Field

flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
stripped_text: Subroutine Do 3 net damage.
text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
title: Neural Katana

flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
stripped_text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. Subroutine Trash 1 AI program. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Swordsman

flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
stripped_text: Subroutine End the run unless the Corp pays 1 credit. Subroutine Do 1 net damage. Subroutine Do 1 net damage. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Tsurugi

flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
stripped_text: Subroutine Do 2 net damage. Subroutine End the run.
text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Wall of Thorns

flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
stripped_text: Subroutine Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Yagura

flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2 credits for each card revealed.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
title: Celebrity Gift

flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
stripped_text: Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn. Do 1 net damage.
text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
title: Neural EMP

flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
stripped_text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
title: Trick of Light

flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
stripped_text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
title: Hokusai Grid

flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits Use these credits during trace attempts.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
title: NBN: Making News

flavor: We're ready to start the fire.
stripped_text: The first time each turn you rez an advertisement, the Runner loses 1 credit.
text: The first time each turn you rez an advertisement, the Runner loses 1[credit].
title: Spark Agency: Worldswide Reach

flavor: It's like Lethal Action 3, only with more explosions.
stripped_text: If Explode-a-palooza is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses Explode-a-palooza, you may gain 5 credits.
text:
If Explode-a-palooza is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Explode-a-palooza, you may gain 5[credit].
title: Explode-a-palooza

stripped_text: When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3. Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
title: Project Beale

flavor: "A new investment deal every morning! Grab the bull by the horns and take control of your future!"
stripped_text: The first effect you draw cards with each turn draws 1 more card. Interrupt  The first time each turn you would draw any number of cards, instead look at that many cards from the top of R&D. Add 1 of those cards to the bottom of R&D, then draw X cards. X is the number of cards you would have drawn minus 1. Errata from CR 1.4
text:
The first effect you draw cards with each turn draws 1 more card.
[interrupt] – The first time each turn you would draw any number of cards, instead look at that many cards from the top of R&D. Add 1 of those cards to the bottom of R&D, then draw X cards. X is the number of cards you would have drawn minus 1.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
title: Daily Business Show

stripped_text: Ghost Branch can be advanced. When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
title: Ghost Branch

text:
When your turn begins, take 1[credit] from Marked Accounts, if able.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Marked Accounts.
title: Marked Accounts

flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.
stripped_text: Reversed Accounts can be advanced. click, trash: The Runner loses 4 credits for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: The Runner loses 4[credit] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
title: Reversed Accounts

stripped_text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. Subroutine Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
title: Data Raven

flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.

text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
title: Flare

flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory

When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[credit].

flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."

When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.

flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise

text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.

Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.

flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
title: Psychographics

flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech

text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[credit] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.

flavor: Moving Upwards.
stripped_text: Gain 1 credit whenever you play a transaction operation.
stripped_title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World
text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.
title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

flavor: Unlimited Energy. Reasonable Prices.

text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 rezzed card to HQ and gain credits equal to its rez cost.
title: Blue Sun: Powering the Future

flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.
stripped_text: When you score Hostile Takeover, gain 7 credits and take 1 bad publicity.
text: When you score Hostile Takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.

text:
Install Oaktown Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Oaktown Renovation, gain 2[credit] (or 3[credit] if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on Oaktown Renovation).

stripped_text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
title: Project Atlas

flavor: "You want no questions asked, hire someone else. I have two: who and how much?"
stripped_text: Contract Killer can be advanced. If there are at least 2 advancement tokens on Contract Killer, it gains: "click, trash: Trash a connection or do 2 meat damage."
text: Contract Killer can be advanced. If there are at least 2 advancement tokens on Contract Killer, it gains: "[click], [trash]: Trash a connection or do 2 meat damage."
title: Contract Killer

flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
stripped_text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. click, trash: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.

Place 3 power counters on Public Support when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Public Support, add it to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Public Support.

flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.

flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.

text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 3[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, end the run.

flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. His constructs live up to it though." -g00ru

text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.

stripped_text: Hortum can be advanced. If Hortum has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, its subroutines cannot be broken by AI programs and resolve the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it). Subroutine The Corp gains 1 credit. (The Corp gains 4 credits.) Subroutine End the run. (Search R&D for up to 2 cards and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D. End the run.) Errata from FAQ 4.0
text: Hortum can be advanced. If Hortum has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, its subroutines cannot be broken by AI programs and resolve the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it). [subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit]. (The Corp gains 4[credit].) [subroutine] End the run. (Search R&D for up to 2 cards and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D. End the run.) Errata from FAQ 4.0
title: Hortum

flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
stripped_text: Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it. Subroutine End the run.
text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Ice Wall

flavor: "Let me tell you a secret. There's no such thing as impenetrable ice. It has to allow access, or else why is the server on the Network in the first place? But that doesn't mean they have to make it easy." -g00ru
stripped_text: Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run.
text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Spiderweb

flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
stripped_text: Gain 3 credits.
text: Gain 3[credit].
title: Beanstalk Royalties

stripped_text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
title: Oversight AI

flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."

text: <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
title: Punitive Counterstrike

flavor: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gagarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.

flavor: It is just like the one you just bought, only better.

"Hey, hey! Wake up, man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."
